attributes.action: Ban drinking alcohol in Parliament by MP's
attributes.background: Alcohol at work is not allowed as it is unsafe and people can make decisions that when they were sober they may consider what they did was inappropriate.  So why when the interest of the UK is being debated and voted on by MP's are they allowed to be under the influence of alcohol.

attributes.action: Establish Hallowe'en  (31st October) as an annual national statutory holiday.
attributes.background: Hallowe'en has grown in popularity in the UK as a non-religious, community event.  This celebration encourages creativity as children make costumes & characters. Trick-or-treating encourages people to get out into their neighbourhoods and enjoy a home-made, creative festival together.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no other autumn holidays in the UK and would occur at a midpoint between the August Bank Holiday and Christmas. 
2. The historic origins of Hallowe'en are outlined on the Historic UK: http://www.historic-uk.com/CultureUK/Halloween/
3. This link which outlines some risks and debunks some unfounded fears. http://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1933329,00.html .  This holiday could promote safe driving to enable children be safe outside at all times of year.

attributes.action: I want Irlens Syndrome to be noticed more across the uk in primary school
attributes.background: I have suffered with Irlens Syndrome my whole life, and only found out in college that it was something I had struggled with, this  is why I think that it should be noticed earlier in primary school as the children would get support and the grades they can or could achieve
attributes.additional_details:
http://irlen.com/what-is-irlen-syndrome/

This is the official wedsite for Irlens Syndrome and explains all the details, and also explains that it affects all areas of your development.

Secondly with Irlens affecting all areas of people's development, it makes it very difficult to concentrate in lesssons, also as schools have flourecsent lighting in nearly all of them this is strain for our eye but also difficult to look at the board, which then means no concentration and no learning.

attributes.action: Increase penalties the Electoral Commission can impose in serious cases
attributes.background:
The EC say they would've levied larger fines after probing election expenses.
They reported "numerous failures by a large...experienced party" which likely gave an advantage.
To protect democracy, we need penalties that WON'T be viewed by parties as "a cost of doing business"-a risk EC warns of.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thecanary.co/2017/03/16/channel-4s-jon-snow-just-slammed-bbc-coverage-tory-election-fraud/
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-39289195
http://www.electionexpenses.co.uk/

attributes.action: Offer mental health assessments to every NHS patient
attributes.background: The government claim to care about mental health. Now it's time they proved it. We believe that every NHS patient should be made aware of the help on offer, and directly offered an assessment, so that they know the option is there. This will help to remove the stigma attached to asking for help.
attributes.additional_details: We see healthy eating campaigns, flu jab campaigns and no smoking, why not have posters asking if we need a "mind check-up" too? It's just as important as a flu jab, and could truly reduce NHS costs, as the problem is tackled before it grows into something more serious.

attributes.action: MAKE SCID NEWBORN SCREENING AVAILABLE ON THE NHS
attributes.background: SCID is a disorder that can be tested from birth to determine if a child has a deficiency of RAG 1 & 2, which is essential TCR & BCR development. Children that have SCID basically have no immune system and in many cases this is discovered around 6 months and in most cases is fatal.
attributes.additional_details: screening from birth will contribute to giving children with SCID an increased survival rate. Rather than waiting until the child becomes unwell and then discovering that their body cannot produce T-cells to fight the infection. If made aware earlier the bone marrow transplant will have an increased chance of being accepted, this will increase the death rates within the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Change the standards for disabled travelling on all public transport.
attributes.background: At the moment most companies comply with the set standards for disabled travellers. But this isn't enough, one wheelchair space per bus or train often leaves disabled people waiting at station because the designated spot is full. There need to be more than one space. The bare minimum isn't enough.
attributes.additional_details: My brother is in a wheelchair he has often been left waiting for up to an hour because the space he needed was full. Also other people are left behind be he is in the space etc.

attributes.action: Increase funding for Insulin Pumps on NHS
attributes.background: As a Type 1 Diabetic on Multiple Daily Injections; it's a struggle. I want HM Government to make a decision to increase the NHS funding for Insulin Pumps to be made readily available to Insulin Dependent Diabetics.

attributes.action: Make GCSE computer science mandatory to prepare young generation for the future.
attributes.background:
Girls and disadvantage children are left behind unprepared for the future as they are denied to study computer science.

Secondary schools are setting up high requirements for maths and other subjects for students to be allowed to take CS GCSE.

Many schools have no girls taking CS GCSE
attributes.additional_details:
The government and the schools need to wake up and realise that even if the students do not achieve high marks, they are still learning and they are still more prepared for their future. 
I was told I'm not good enough to study computer science by my teacher, but I did it anyway and finished with top marks. I have Ba in CS and Ma in IT in education. I run successful business and yes maths never was my thing. Yet I wasn't denied the chance. My niece unfortunately is denied to learn for her future

attributes.action: Introduce legislation requiring contractors to warranty repairs on roads
attributes.background:
Potholes are estimated to cost motorists an estimated £730 million every year.

A large percentage of potholes result from utility company and local council works where the restorative works on the road are sub-standard and which often fail prematurely.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of road repairs falls to Local Authorities, who have a legal obligation to keep roads in good repair. If repairs was carried out to a required standard and contractors required by legislation to warranty the repair, then the Local Authorities would have the legal power to hold road repair contractors and utility companies to account, and either claim the cost of subsequent repair from the organisations that undertake the repair, or force them to restore the damage at their cost

attributes.action: Issuing of a photo ID NHS card to help prevent the inappropriate use of the NHS
attributes.background: I am concerned about the amount of money the government seems unable to claim from what is called "health tourism" and would like to try to prevent it.
attributes.additional_details: I work as a Medical Secretary and am concerned and love my NHS.

attributes.action: Make screening for group B strep a routine screen for women during pregnancy.
attributes.background: Group B streptococcus is a bacteria which lives inside the body and is carried by one in three expectant mothers. The bug can be potentially life-threatening to babies. In the UK, pregnant women are not routinely offered testing for group B Strep, unlike some other developed countries.
attributes.additional_details: Infection from mum to baby is entirely preventable. The test is carried out 35 to 37 weeks. You are given antibiotics in labour to help the baby fight the infection. Many women carry the bacteria. It causes no harm at all but in pregnancy as the baby comes down the birth canal it can pick up the bacteria.

attributes.action: Amend the planning guidance to increase the minimum size for car parking spaces.
attributes.background: Car parking space width is simply not wide enough to allow people to get out and in their vehicle comfortably enough.

attributes.action: Gov to guarantee that ex and current military personnel have homes to live in.
attributes.background:
Since 2013, up to 9,000 British heroes who have served for our country are homeless. Unfairly, our soldiers already fight in treacherous conditions for then to proceed to live in an environment which is inadequate. 
The government should make sure their lives are stabilised
attributes.additional_details: This current government are underserving an impoverished population.This should be prioritised as this creates and increases a despondent underclass

attributes.action: Prisons should train operational support grades at C&R basic level.
attributes.background:
OSG are uniformed members of prison staff that are not legally entitled to take action to stop rioting if it breaks out among inmates and are not legally able to carry out "control and restraint" techniques.
In the event of aggressive behaviour the OSG are not allowed to lay hands on the inmate.
attributes.additional_details:
According to section 3 of NOMS-POA talk 1st Dec 16 OSG’s are not eligible for the reduction in retirement age as they are not in prisoner-facing roles, when infact we can be outside with over 200 prisoners  at a time, visits or even reception are also common areas for OSG to have prisoner contact.
I believe all establishments have a serious deficit by not of training OSG at C&R basic level,The lack of training is an indication of the Prison Service's lack of concern for the safety of staff

attributes.action: Rape offences tried on the balance of probability NOT beyond reasonable doubt
attributes.background: In the UK the conviction rate for rape cases is 4% this is not encouraging for rape victims to come forward. It is extremely difficult to convince a jury to convict a perpetrator beyond all reasonable doubt this is why the numbers are so low I propose I change in the law to help victims of rape
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from The British Crime Survey reveal that 89% of rapes go unreported, and 38% of victims don’t tell anyone. It is unrealistic to assess a rape case beyond all reasonable doubt if the victim is known to the defendant or is the defendants partner etc this is virtually impossible as there will always be the argument of consensual sex therefore giving the element of doubt. 97% of calls to the Rape Crisis helpline are from victims who knew their attackers, if we try defendants based on the balance of probability we will have a better chance of convictions and will incourage more victims to come forward.

attributes.action: Change the legislation regarding the trapping and killing of foxes and wildlife
attributes.background: Currently it is legal to trap foxes and other wildlife in snares and cages and then kill them "humanely." The very act of trapping and killing a wild animal is inhumane and is cruelty at it's best. The law should only allow farmers the right to kill an animal if said animal is causing problems.
attributes.additional_details: Hunters and generally nasty people are using these laws to trap foxes for training their dogs to hunt and kill. Hunting in this country is absolutely pointless and is purely to fulfill a sick ego. If we had bears and predatory animals roaming our streets then hunting would make more sense. The cruelty one can impose on an animal is merely a snapshot into their psyche and gives evidence they are not mentally healthy people who would not think much about inflicting pain on another human.

attributes.action: Make ALL central & local govt. consultations fully transparent and accountable
attributes.background: The larger the public consultation the less public it is. That's because, if the cost of protecting personal data exceeds the £450-600 cap individual comments aren't published. This must change: in a transparent democracy our opinions must be seen, and a clear FOR or AGAINST tally system included.
attributes.additional_details: To avoid any biased government interpretations & calculations of our concerns and wishes, we propose the public always be given access to ALL government consultation materials: http://tiny.cc/gov-data. Our personal data (except postcodes for demographic analysis) should automatically be blacked-out from the outset, and the £ caps scrapped. And, if we are to have any confidence in published consultation results, a simple system to show whether we are FOR or AGAINST a proposal must be introduced.

attributes.action: Declassify intelligence related to possible Russian interference on Brexit vote
attributes.background: The CIA, FBI and NSA jointly concluded that Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign on the 2016 US Election using social media and cyber attacks. Russia would benefit from a weakened European Union. We deserve to be sure the EU Referendum was a free and fair vote without influence.
attributes.additional_details:
US declassified report: https://www.dni.gov/files/documents/ICA_2017_01.pdf

EU sanctioned Russia over crisis in Syria: https://europa.eu/newsroom/highlights/special-coverage/eu_sanctions_en

Like the US Election, the EU Referendum result was not predicted by polls: http://whatukthinks.org/eu/opinion-polls/poll-of-polls/

MI6 Chief, Anthony Young, commented states "further their aims deniably" by "subversion of democratic process": https://www.ft.com/content/2a433552-bd4c-11e6-8b45-b8b81dd5d080

attributes.action: Put a cap on homework for under 17's
attributes.background: The amount of homework is decided by the education minister, who signs acts that will never directly effect him. It has been shown by several studies that excessive amounts of homework can lead to depression, anxiety and even lower grades. I think there should be a cap on homework to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
My sources:
https://factualfacts.com/science-facts/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades-studies-suggest/

http://www.mindmake.com/blog/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/the-squeaky-wheel/201110/how-much-homework-is-too-much

attributes.action: Award a campaign medal for members of Bomber Command in WW2.
attributes.background: 55,573 members of Bomber Command were killed in WW2 and have never received any official recognition for their sacrifice. It is time this injustice was corrected.

attributes.action: Make the HPV vaccine programme aimed towards both sexes instead of only females.
attributes.background: The HPV vaccine (the 'jab' females are highly recommended to get before sexual activity) is not only necessary for females but males as well to help prevent anal, throat and penile cancers, as well as over 100 types of HPV diseases.
attributes.additional_details: Males are not encouraged to receive this vaccine before sexual activity based on the logic that if females don't have the HPV infections then males won't receive them through sexual contact. This leaves males who have sex with males vulnerable to the infections as well as ignoring the benefits the injection has to prevent multiple cancers. The NHS has been encouraging this change for years yet no action has been taken, leaving males uneducated in the matter and at risk of major health hazards.

attributes.action: Make all care homes/care providers not for profit organisations
attributes.background: After many documentaries about undignified/unsafe  inadequate care homes, we need to do something. Most homes/services are understaffed under trained and underpaid due to the owners/providers wanting high profits. And the people that suffer are the residents/clients.
attributes.additional_details:
Panorama documentaries 
Cqc reports 
I have personally worked in care for many years and have experiences the poor quality first hand. It's about the time the government does something about it.

attributes.action: Increase pay of classroom assistants/ LSAs to nearer the national average wage
attributes.background: I work as I class TA. I am not paid enough to make a living on my own. I am lucky to have a wonderful husband to help me but I want to fight on behalf of myself and for my colleagues who work extremely hard every day and put hours and hours of work in.
attributes.additional_details: The national wage for a NQT teacher within the U.K starts at £22,244 and I as a class TA earn £11,000 a year. I feel at times I can work just as hard and spend the same hours at school as some teachers. I'm not asking for the same wage as teachers but i believe TA/LSA should be earning more money so we can make a living for ourselves.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: Make statutory holiday entitlement 26 days plus bank holidays
attributes.background: Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that the government raise statutory holiday entitlement to 26 days per year plus bank holidays (34 total) to enable working parents to cover childcare during school holidays. The legal entitlement at present is 28 days and employers can choose to have 8 of those as bank holidays.
Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.

attributes.action: Increase the fine on mobile phone use while driving to a minimum of £10,000
attributes.background: I'm sick of having near misses while cycling to and from work due to car drivers illegally using mobile phones while driving. This problem is becoming an epidemic, it's time to get tough on the law breakers who endanger innocent lives.

attributes.action: Restrict the usage of fireworks to a 2 hour time slot (6-8pm or 7-9pm)
attributes.background: The law in the UK currently states that you may not set off fireworks between 11pm and 7am, except for Diwali, New Year and Chinese New Year, when it's 1am. Requesting a change from these hours to a reasonable 2 hour time slot will help people with young families and pets during this time.
attributes.additional_details:
Built up areas/residential areas: The sound of multiple displays up until 11pm/1am can be deafening as the bangs reverberate off buildings and wake sleeping children/stress out pets.
Fireworks have a 120 db sound limit: This is the same as a thunderclap. With multiple fireworks going off simultaneously and sounding like a thunderstorm for up to 5/7 hours straight, this can be extremely frightening for young children, babies and pets, as well as the elderly and any servicemen and women with PTSD.

attributes.action: Investigate effects of the reform of IR35 legislation on Public Sector Projects
attributes.background: On April 5th 2017 HMRC will reform the intermediaries legislation in Chapter 8 Part 2 Income Taxes (Earnings and Pensions) Act 2003 (“ITEPA 2003”) often known as IR35. The impending arrival of this clumsy legislation has already introduced huge risk and budget overuns into.public sector projects.
attributes.additional_details: The communication around the impending legislation change has been extremely poor and many organisations have subsequently lost huge swathes of experienced resources critical to sucessful delivery. Furthermore the legislation is seen as unecessarily punitive on limted companies who provide knowledge skills and expertise.  HMRC are seeking to differentiate these companies by terming them Personal Service Companies (a term which has no basis in law) and to punitively discriminate against them.

attributes.action: Stop Mandatory Overtime for Parents of Disabled and Poorly Children
attributes.background: Quite often parents of disabled and poorly children are expected by their employer to work additional hours above the contracted amount, often at short notice. This expectation, if not met, can to lead to poor performance ratings, missed promotion opportunities and sometimes disciplinary action.
attributes.additional_details: For parents of these children being at home to support their family is paramount. Being forced into mandatory overtime can have a severe impact on the child's development, cause stress within a parents relationship and prevent a strong and robust support network for both the child and parent career. Removing the expectation of overtime and allowing parents to opt out of working any additional hours would eliminate stress, reassure the family and set clear boundaries to the employer.

attributes.action: Government remove failing Academy Trusts after two years of inadequate results
attributes.background:
Academy School Trusts failing children are allowed to continue with no public scrutiny.  Trust are a business model if results are not delivered then changes to who runs the School should be made . 
 Policy should be in place for intervention  at local  government level. Children need our support.

attributes.action: Allow Donald trump free access to the UK during his presidency.
attributes.background:
Many people have been asking to ban him ? Why?

People are in outrage over a temporary ban that had been twisted by the media, Obama did this in 2011 where was his ban petition.

Please deny all future ban requests.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Nit Nurse and make lice treatments free for children up to age 16
attributes.background: The lack of nit education and Nit treatments being taken off the minor ailment scheme results in more infestations and less treatment being administered. With most brands of treatment ranging from £8-£15 per treatment it is a costly affair to treat the whole family effectively.
attributes.additional_details: The reinstatement of the Nit Nurse in all primary schools and the access to free head lice treatment will go a long way to combat the problem.

attributes.action: Payment terms exceeding 30 days from when an invoice is issued should be illegal
attributes.background: I am the director of a small electrical contracting company. It is about time something was done about the big company's who think it is acceptable to make smaller companies, especially in construction, wait ridiculous amounts of time for payment. Small businesses regularly go bust due to this.
attributes.additional_details: All company's from bottom of the pile to the top should be legally required to pay no later than 30 days from invoice

attributes.action: We demand a referendum for any US-UK trade deal
attributes.background: The deal being stitched up by Present-elect Trump and the UK government could have wide consequences for our public services and the status of the UK with our European neighbours. The effect on the NHS, our education system and a range of public services could be catastrophic for ordinary people.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Landlords must declare mortgage arrears or court proceedings related to property
attributes.background: This petition is to make it law that a landlord must declare whether there are any ongoing court proceedings in relation to the property being let (such as repossession, power of sale etc) and/or any mortgage arrears prior to a tenancy agreement being issued.
attributes.additional_details: In November 2015 I took out a 12 month assured tenancy agreement with no break clause. 4 months into the tenancy it became apparent that our landlord was in mortgage arrears prior to our tenancy, that repossession proceedings had began regarding the property and that a further court case meant that power of sale was provided to a third party to dispose of the property. As tenants we should have been made aware of these issues prior to our tenancy beginning given the complications this creates.

attributes.action: Make individuals' contributions to the DFID International Aid budget voluntary
attributes.background: The international aid budget is out of control and management of it is not fit for purpose since much of it is wasted through ill advised means of spending or just plain poor management by, amongst others, unelected staff with their own agenda. Many UK citizens believe 'charity begins at home'.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing citizens to either 'opt in' or 'opt out' through their annual tax return, HMRC will still be able to collect the tax from those who wish to pay it while allowing others to pay their contribution to their preferred, domestic, budgets. Overall, the actual percentage size of the budget will reflect the proportion of citizens willing to pay for overseas aid.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools enforce their school bullying policies legally
attributes.background: Schools legally have to have bullying policies but they do not legally have to enforce their policies as they currently only have discretionary meaning. They legally don't have any powers to enforce their policies and this has to be changed for safety well-being of all children's no 1 priority.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics released say 1.5 million pupils are bullied verbally or physically or both in the last 12 months which was on national news TV etc. Therefore it's children's and pupils' lives that are being ruined and destroyed and society in general and schools are failing to act cause of current policies and legislations and have no powers.
attributes.creator_name: Stephen McCulloch On Behalf Of Anti Bullying Ambassadors

attributes.action: The Home Secretary to approve the routine arming of police officers in the UK
attributes.background: The nature of policing in the UK has changed over past years, with ad-hoc and individual acts of terrorism becoming more common. In this environment, police officers are faced with situations where they lack the equipment and training to protect themselves or members of the public. This must change.
attributes.additional_details: Recent examples of attacks in the UK include the killing of Lee Rigby, and the murder of officer Keith Palmer at the Palace of Westminster. Other examples of similar attacks have arisen in France, Belgium and Germany. However, in those countries an armed response was provided by the first police officers on scene.

attributes.action: It's time to force Yodel, Hermes and all other rogue couriers to be regulated
attributes.background: There is currently no official regulatory body in place to hold courier companies accountable for their infamously poor standards of delivery and customer service. More stringent regulations would ensure that they must meet these basic standards and allow complaints to be formally investigated.
attributes.additional_details: Yodel and Hermes, to name just two of these companies, have already been much publicised for their poor reputation. For reference see BBC's Watchdog, or the current Twitter feed of @yodelonline. Time and time again these companies fall back on their tightly worded contractual Ts & Cs ensuring that their errors are not held accountable for. These companies exist to undercut the market at the cost of the buyer and it is high time that they are held to task.

attributes.action: Introduce a new British Passport
attributes.background: Re-introduce the style of British Passport that the UK had before this country joined the Common Market, latterly know as the EU. Now the UK has voted overwhelmingly to leave the EU, it is right that the name of the European Union is removed from all new issued British Passports forthwith.

attributes.action: Reconsider the decision to remove housing benefit for young people (18 - 21)
attributes.background:
More jobless young people could be made to live on the streets as the Government moves ahead with plans to end housing support payments for under-21s.

On Friday officials published secondary legislation to go ahead with the plans, while most MPs were at home in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1:
 http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/housing-benefit-young-people-18-21-scrapped-universal-credit-exemptions-a7610581.html

attributes.action: Reduce the 10 years Ban for anyone who has at any stage been illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: A new law that deprives qualified settled residents in the UK of becoming British Citizens was enacted in 2014, which has affected a lot of people and has hindered some people from taking up their dream profession which requires you to hold a British passport. There is currently a 10 years ban
attributes.additional_details: This is a plea to the home office to either reduce the length of ban or allow settled residents who have held their permanent residence for over 12 months naturalize .

attributes.action: For the production, sale & use of whole plant medical cannabis to be legal.
attributes.background:
Exempts patients & defined caregivers who possess or cultivate marijuana for medical treatment recommended by a physician from criminal laws which otherwise prohibit possession or cultivation of marijuana.
Furthermore, legalise the sale of medical marijauna in dispensaries for these patients only.
attributes.additional_details:
Medical marijuana has been seen to improve the lives of some of the patients (in some cases reverse) with the following conditions: Alzheimer's disease, arthritis, ADHD, ASD, autoimmune diseases, cachexia, cancer, CFS, GI disorders , fibromyalgia, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, insomnia, MS, neuropathy, Parkinson's disease, PTSD, seizure disorders and many others.
Notably the whole plant as it's compounds work in synergy. 
Additionally, in all these cases the benefits far outweigh the supposed dangers.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Review and reform behavior during debates within the House of Commons.
attributes.background: Many citizens of this country are  appalled by the jeering, cheering, and most unacceptably, laughter that characterizes PMQs and every other debate that takes place in the chamber at The House of Commons. This childish behavior demonstrates a general disinterest in engaging in robust debate.
attributes.additional_details: When the future of this country is being discussed, when welfare cuts that destroy lives and families are being discussed, it is disgusting to see jokes being made and heartily laughed at. General disorder slows the processes of power and disrupts the scrutiny of government. An immediate review and reform of the guidelines of MPs parliamentary behavior should be enacted. Those who cannot behave in a way befitting the seriousness of political discourse should be disciplined.

attributes.action: Prevent UK government from using Trump Organisation venues, services, products.
attributes.background: Mr D J Trump is President of the USA. He refuses to separate his business holdings from his Office. His interests include hotels, golf clubs and restaurants and enterprises such as office accommodation. He stands personally to profit from U.K. Government/taxpayer spending, which would be corrupt.
attributes.additional_details: Please see the website of the Trump Organisation, as well as extensive recent international press coverage on this problematic issue. There is also a current lawsuit, brought against him for benefiting from the lease of his latest Trump Hotel in Washington, which is a state owned building and where the relevant lease prohibits a federal employee from benefiting from said lease.

attributes.action: Compulsory for UK schools to teach about sexual consent.
attributes.background: In the UK, it's not compulsory for schools to teach anything about sexual consent or healthy relationships, only about the biology of sex. Before teenagers are sexually active, consent education will give them the power to recognise when receiving or inflicting abuse/exploitation/rape.
attributes.additional_details: On average, the age of first intercourse experience is 15.6 years (14.9 for men and 15.9 for women). It seems, the majority of teenagers are sexually active before the legal age. It is for this reason, sexual consent must be taught before the age of 16. Not just our daughters should leave school able to navigate the sexual challenges and choices they’ll face in adulthood but more importantly boys. Schools must become educators and advocates of sex-positivity/healthy consent for both genders.
